meaning: Expresses a limit or extent; 'it's only up to...', 'no more than...'.
formation: Verb (dictionary/ない form) + までだ, い-Adjective + までだ, Noun + までだ

examples.japanese: 彼とは友達までだ。それ以上の関係ではありません。
examples.english: With him, it's only friendship—nothing more.

examples.japanese: 飲み放題は9時までだ。それ以降は追加料金が必要だ。
examples.english: The all-you-can-drink deal is only until nine. After that, there's an extra charge.

name: ～もなんでもない (〜mo nandemonai)
meaning: Used to dismiss or negate something’s importance; 'it’s nothing at all', 'it doesn’t matter'.
formation: Verb-dictionary form + もなんでもない, い-Adjective + もなんでもない, な-Adjective + なもなんでもない, Noun + もなんでもない

examples.japanese: 100万円を負けるもなんでもない。
examples.english: Losing a million yen is no big deal at all.

examples.japanese: 彼が社長だもなんでもない。
examples.english: It doesn't matter one bit that he's the president.

name: ～ものとして (～mono to shite)
meaning: Indicates an assumption or supposition; 'assuming', 'under the assumption that'.
formation: Verb-casual + ものとして, い-Adjective + ものとして, な-Adjective + なものとして, Noun + のものとして

examples.japanese: 雨が降るものとして、傘を持って行きました。
examples.english: Assuming it would rain, I took an umbrella.

examples.japanese: 彼が病気なものとして、代わりに私が出席した。
examples.english: On the assumption that he was sick, I attended in his place.

name: ～んがために (〜n ga tame ni)
meaning: Emphasizes the reason or purpose for an action; 'in order to', 'for the sake of'.
formation: Verb-negative stem + んがために

examples.japanese: 健康を保たんがために、毎日運動をしています。
examples.english: I exercise daily in order to maintain my health.

examples.japanese: 合格せんがために、一生懸命勉強します。
examples.english: I study hard in order to pass.

name: ～んばかりに (〜n bakari ni)
meaning: Indicates 'as though about to ~' or 'as if to say ~'.
formation: Verb-negative stem + ん + ばかりに

examples.japanese: 彼は何も知らんばかりに、私の質問を無視した。
examples.english: He ignored my question as if he didn’t know anything.

examples.japanese: その子は泣かんばかりに顔をしかめた。
examples.english: The child made a face as if he were about to cry.

name: ～差し支えない (〜sashitsukaenai)
meaning: Indicates no problem or obstacle; 'it’s fine if...', 'there’s no issue'.
formation: Verb-て form + も差し支えない, Noun + が差し支えない

examples.japanese: 多少遅くても差し支えないです。
examples.english: It’s no problem if you’re a bit late.

examples.japanese: 部屋が少し汚くても差し支えない。
examples.english: It doesn’t matter if the room is slightly messy.

name: ～折に (〜ori ni)
meaning: Indicates the time or occasion when something happens; 'when', 'at the time of'.
formation: Verb-dictionary form + 折に, Verb-た形 + 折に, Noun + の折に

examples.japanese: 父が病気の折に、私は留学していました。
examples.english: When my father was ill, I was studying abroad.

examples.japanese: 日本へ行く折に、お土産を買ってきてください。
examples.english: When you go to Japan, please buy souvenirs.

name: ～極まりない (〜kiwamarinai)
meaning: Expresses an extreme state, often negative; 'utterly', 'extremely', 'boundlessly'.
formation: な-Adjective（語幹）+ 極まりない, い-Adjective（連用形）+ こと + 極まりない, Noun + の極まりない

examples.japanese: 彼の失礼な態度は極まりない。
examples.english: His rude attitude is utterly beyond words.

examples.japanese: その運転は危険極まりない。
examples.english: That driving is extremely dangerous.

name: ～極まる (〜kiwamaru)
meaning: Also expresses an extreme degree or state, typically negative.
formation: な-Adjective（語幹）+ 極まる, い-Adjective（連用形）+ こと + 極まる, etc.

examples.japanese: 彼の言動は失礼極まる。
examples.english: His words and actions are extremely rude.

examples.japanese: その態度は非常識極まる。
examples.english: That behavior is utterly irrational.

name: ～足りない (～tarinai)
meaning: Expresses insufficiency or lack; 'not enough', 'insufficient'.
formation: Noun + (が) 足りない, Verb-casual + ほど/だけ + (が) 足りない

examples.japanese: 私の日本語の能力はまだまだ足りない。
examples.english: My Japanese skills are still not enough.

examples.japanese: 時間が足りないから、今すぐ行かなきゃ。
examples.english: We don't have enough time, so we must go right now.

name: ～足る Noun (〜taru Noun)
meaning: Indicates that something is worthy or sufficient to be called/used as ~; 'worthy of', 'enough to ~'.
formation: Noun/Verb-dictionary form + に足る + Noun

examples.japanese: 彼は信頼に足る人物だ。
examples.english: He is a person worthy of trust.

examples.japanese: この小説は読むに足る価値がある。
examples.english: This novel is well worth reading.

name: ～限りだ (〜kagiri da)
meaning: Expresses an extreme degree of emotion or reaction; 'I feel so ~', 'as ~ as can be'.
formation: い-Adjective + 限りだ, な-Adjective + な/である + 限りだ, Noun + の + 限りだ

examples.japanese: 彼女が急に辞めてしまった。驚きの限りだ。
examples.english: She suddenly quit. I'm as shocked as can be.

examples.japanese: 息子が成功した。嬉しい限りだ。
examples.english: My son succeeded. I'm so happy.
